As you may have guessed, sadly, we are postponing our Fall Fest this year. This would have been our 5th year having it, so in honor of that, we want to create a cookbook fundraiser. We have had many great chili entries and last year, a variety of Crock-Pot recipes, so please share your recipes with us so we can make a great cookbook!

If you entered it in the cook-off and had a winning entry PLEASE NOTE WITH RECIPE.

ANY type of recipe will be accepted. So whatever is a family favorite in any category, please share!

Please send your recipes to pta@hampton29.com. Include your name and students name(s) and if it was a fall fest winning entry in the past or if it's just a family fave. You may submit as many recipes as you want.

We hope to have this ready for orders by Holiday time.

Congratulations, Bennett!

We hope you are having a nice Easter with your families today!

We also wanted to take a moment to acknowledge the loss of Hampton's Police Chief, Terry Engle. Many of you would see Terry almost every morning at school drop off. He kept watch over the kids as they arrived at school and played until the bell rang. He always made our school a priority and worked closely with our principal to make sure our kids were safe.
Terry was always willing to help us out whether it was donating glow sticks for Fall Fest, judging our cookie bake off, donating a police ride a long to be auctioned off or bikes for the kids raffle. He was the driving force in starting Blue & Red Christmas for Hampton/Rapids City kids, which PTA was always happy to support. These are just a few of the memories we have of him and I'm sure the list from his friends and family could go on forever. He will be greatly missed.
RIP Chief.

Scott McKissick
